Static Public Member Functions

CrystalSession Class Reference

The interface to all of the Crystal SDK functionality. Though all of the methods are implemented as class methods for ease of use the client must call initWithAppID: to initiate the session as soon as is convenient. More...

#import <CrystalSession.h>

List of all members.

Static Public Member Functions

(void) + initWithAppID:delegate:version:theme:secretKey:
 Initializes the crystal session. This method should be called as soon as your game has activated fully. The session must run in the background so that the game can submit high scores, analytics etc.
(void) + lockToOrientation:
 Locks the crystal UI to the specified orientation.Just call this once after initializing the session. All orientations are supported. If your application supports more than one screen orientation use lockToOrientationList: instead.
(void) + lockToOrientationList:
 Locks the crystal UI to the specified list of orientations.Just call this once after initializing the session. All orientations are supported. A typical usage of this call is to limit Crystal to only the landscape orientations like so: [CrystalSession lockToOrientationList:[NSArray arrayWithObjects:[NSNumber numberWithInt:UIDeviceOrientationLandscapeLeft], [NSNumber numberWithInt:UIDeviceOrientationLandscapeRight], nil] ];
(void) + closeCrystalSession
 Closes the Crystal session. This should only be called when absolutely necessary for memory usage reasons. The Crystal session without the UI is very small, so this should cause no problems. Without a running sesssion high scores, achievements and analytics will not be posted to the server.
(BOOL) + isCrystalUIActive
 Determine if the Crystal UI is currently active and visible.Returns YES if active and visible, otherwise returns NO.
(void) + activateCrystalUI
 Activates the Crystal user interface with the default view options.On iPhone before calling this method your application should stop rendering and stop sound if not appropriate to the Crystal UI.
On iPad this method is used to activate the Crystal navigation tabs at the left of the screen. Please see http://devsupport.crystalsdk.com/default.asp?W8 for more details.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtProfile
 Activates the Crystal user interface with the 'profile' tab open.On iPhone this is equivelant to calling activateCrystalUI. On iPad this method can be used to activate the Crystal UI from a dedicated Crystal button, though the permanent overlay via activateCrystalUI is preferred. Please see http://devsupport.crystalsdk.com/default.asp?W8 for more details.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtChallenges
 Activates the Crystal user interface with the 'challenges' tab open.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtLeaderboards
 Activates the Crystal user interface with the 'leaderboards' tab open.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtLeaderboardWithId:
 Activates the Crystal user interface with the 'leaderboards' tab open at the specified leaderboard.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtAchievements
 Activates the Crystal user interface with the 'achievements' tab open.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtAddFriends
 Activates the Crystal user interface at the 'Add more friends' screen.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtSettings
 Activates the Crystal user interface at the 'Settings' screen.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtGifting
 Activates the Crystal user interface at the gifting and promotions functionality.If the theme for your game has a gifting/promotions tab defined this will open the Crystal UI at this tab. If the theme doesn't have this tab then the UI will be opened at the Profile tab but with the gifting/promotions functionality visible.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtVirtualGoods
 Activates the Crystal user interface at the virtual goods functionality.If the theme for your game has a gifting/promotions tab defined this will open the Crystal UI at this tab. If the theme doesn't have this tab then the UI will be opened at the Profile tab but with the virtual goods functionality visible.
(void) + activateCrystalUIAtVirtualCurrencies
 Activates the Crystal user interface at the virtual currency functionality.If the theme for your game has a gifting/promotions tab defined this will open the Crystal UI at this tab. If the theme doesn't have this tab then the UI will be opened at the Profile tab but with the virtual currencies functionality visible.
(void) + deactivateCrystalUI
 Forces the Crystal UI to be removed from view.On iPhone in normal circumstances it shouldn't be necessary to call this method, but is added for completeness in case the client receives its own notifications.
On iPad this method is used to dismiss the Crystal navigation tabs at the left of the screen.
(void) + activateCrystalSetting:value:
 Sets values for various internal Crystal settings. This method is provided for developers to activate workarounds for bugs on the iPhone and the graphics libraries used by developers.
(void) + displaySplashScreen
 Displays the Crystal splash screenThis method displays the Crystal splash screen to the user above the current game UI. It is the responsibility of the developer to ensure that this dialog is displayed at an appropriate time, generally just after the game is started. When the splash screen has been dismissed splashScreenFinishedWithActivateCrystal: will be called in the delegate. Normally the game would only display this splash screen once to the user.
(BOOL) + DEPRECATED_ATTRIBUTE
 Determines whether the user has signed into Crystal This method can be used to determine whether the user has signed into Crystal. The result of this method can be used to display promotional UI elements in the game UI to encourage the use of Crystal-enabled features.
(void) + TEST_deleteCrystalUserData
 
  • TESTING ONLY - Deletes any user data for Crystal for testing purposes. Any data stored on the server is not deleted however.

(void) + postChallengeResultForLastChallenge:withCrystalDialog:
 Post the result of the last challenge that the game was notified for.The game will be notified of the challenge via the challengeStartedWithGameConfig: method of CrystalSessionDelegate.
(BOOL) + postAchievement:wasObtained:withDescription:alwaysPopup:
 Notify the Crystal servers and the user (via a popup notification) that an achievement has been completed.The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding excessive popups is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever an achievement is achieved. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.
(void) + postAchievementAsync:wasObtained:withDescription:alwaysPopup:
 Notify the Crystal servers and the user (via a popup notification) that an achievement has been completed.The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding excessive popups is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever an achievement is achieved. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device. This asynchronous method should be invoked if game designers experience performance issues calling postAchievement.
(BOOL) + postAchievement:wasObtained:withDescription:alwaysPopup:forGameCenterAchievementId:
 Notify the Crystal servers and the user (via a popup notification) that an achievement has been completed.The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding excessive popups is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever an achievement is achieved. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.
(void) + postAchievementAsync:wasObtained:withDescription:alwaysPopup:forGameCenterAchievementId:
 Notify the Crystal servers and the user (via a popup notification) that an achievement has been completed.The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding excessive popups is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever an achievement is achieved. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device. This asynchronous method should be invoked if game designers experience performance issues calling postAchievement.
(void) + postAchievementProgressWithCrystalId:gameCenterId:percentageComplete:achievementDescription:
 Report progress made towards an achievement both to Crystal and Game CenterThis method updates the Crystal UI to show the progress that the player has made towards an achievement in plain text. This method also updates Game Center to report the percentage complete for the achievement. Achievement popups are not shown if this method is called.
(void) + postLeaderboardResult:forLeaderboardId:lowestValFirst:
 Notify the Crystal servers of a leaderboard result for the specified leaderboard ID.The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding unneeded posts is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever a score is scored. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.
(void) + postLeaderboardResult:forLeaderboardId:lowestValFirst:forGameCenterLeaderboardId:
 Notify the Crystal servers of a leaderboard result for the specified leaderboard ID.The game designer should not attempt to cache, buffer or otherwise restrict the number of times this method is called. All logic with regards to reducing server load, handling multiple users and avoiding unneeded posts is handled within the Crystal SDK. Please call this method whenever a score is scored. Failure to do so will almost certainly cause problems for multiple Crystal users on the same device.
(BOOL) + appWasStartedFromPendingChallenge
 Ask the session whether the application was started from an incoming challenge (push) notification.
(BOOL) + isGameCenterAvailableOnDevice
 Tests to see if Game Center is available for use on the deviceUse this method to determine if Game Center is avaialble on the device at runtime. Game Center will only be available for iOS 4.1 and above.
(void) + application:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken:
(void) + application:didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithError:
(void) + application:didReceiveRemoteNotification:
(BOOL) + application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:
(BOOL) + application:handleOpenUrl:
(void) + willRotateToInterfaceOrientation:duration:
 Call this from your top-level view controller if your game uses Apple's UIViewController or subclasses.All view rotations are supported by Crystal, though you can limit this in your own app. If the view rotation is to be limited to one rotation (recommended) call the lockToOrientation: method on CrystalSession. If you would like to support more than one rotation call the lockToOrientationList: method.
(void) + didRotateFromInterfaceOrientation:
 Call this from your top-level view controller if your game uses Apple's UIViewController or subclasses.All view rotations are supported by Crystal, though you can limit this in your own app. If the view rotation is to be limited to one rotation (recommended) call the lockToOrientation: method on CrystalSession. If you would like to support more than one rotation call the lockToOrientationList: method.
(void) + activateCrystalPullTabOnNewsFromScreenEdge:
 Activates the Crystal pull tab user interface on the 'News' screen. This is a basic news feed that features adverts and three modes of display.
(void) + activateCrystalPullTabOnNewsFromScreenEdge:closed:
 Activates the Crystal pull tab user interface on the 'News' screen in the specified closed state. This is a basic news feed that features adverts and three modes of display.
(void) + activateCrystalPullTabOnLeaderboardsFromScreenEdge:
 Activates the Crystal pull tab user interface on the 'Leaderboards' screen.
(void) + activateCrystalPullTabOnLeaderboardWithId:fromScreenEdge:
 Activates the Crystal pull tab user interface with a specific leaderboard to be displayed.
(void) + activateCrystalPullTabOnGiftsFromScreenEdge:
 Activates the Crystal pull tab user interface on the 'Gifting' screen.
(void) + activateCrystalPullTabOnChallengesFromScreenEdge:
 Activates the Crystal pull tab user interface on the 'challenges' screen.
(void) + activateCrystalPullTabOnAchievementsFromScreenEdge:
 Activates the Crystal pull tab user interface on the 'achievements' screen.
(void) + deactivateCrystalPullTab
 Deactivates the Crystal pull tab user interface. This will animate the pull tab off screen.

Detailed Description

The interface to all of the Crystal SDK functionality. Though all of the methods are implemented as class methods for ease of use the client must call initWithAppID: to initiate the session as soon as is convenient.

Member Function Documentation

+ (void) activateCrystalSetting: (CrystalSetting)  setting
value: (id)  value 

Sets values for various internal Crystal settings. This method is provided for developers to activate workarounds for bugs on the iPhone and the graphics libraries used by developers.

Parameters:
setting the CrystalSetting to set
value the value to set for this setting, which will generally be "YES" to activate a setting
+ (void) closeCrystalSession  

Closes the Crystal session. This should only be called when absolutely necessary for memory usage reasons. The Crystal session without the UI is very small, so this should cause no problems. Without a running sesssion high scores, achievements and analytics will not be posted to the server.

+ (BOOL) DEPRECATED_ATTRIBUTE  

Determines whether the user has signed into Crystal This method can be used to determine whether the user has signed into Crystal. The result of this method can be used to display promotional UI elements in the game UI to encourage the use of Crystal-enabled features.

Returns:
YES if the user is signed into Crystal
Deprecated:
This method is deprecated. Please use the isSignedIn method on the CrystalPlayer API instead.
+ (void) initWithAppID: (NSString *)  appId
delegate: (id< CrystalSessionDelegate >)  delegate
version: (double)  version
theme: (NSString *)  theme
secretKey: (NSString *)  secretKey 

Initializes the crystal session. This method should be called as soon as your game has activated fully. The session must run in the background so that the game can submit high scores, analytics etc.

Parameters:
appId The Application ID for this application, as obtained from the Developer Dashboard
delegate The class implementing the CrystalSessionDelegate to receive notifications from the session
version The version of your application, which must match one of the versions shown in the Developer Dashboard
theme The theme to use for the Crystal UI. This must match the .crystaltheme file included in the application bundle and would be 'violet_002' for the theme file 'violet_002.crystaltheme'.
secretKey The secret key string shown in the Developer Dashboard for this application
+ (void) TEST_deleteCrystalUserData  

  • TESTING ONLY - Deletes any user data for Crystal for testing purposes. Any data stored on the server is not deleted however.
